Romney used private e-mail to conduct state business

The former Mass. governor and some of his top aides used private e-mail to conduct state business, a possibly risky practice, cyber security experts said. (AP, 4:18 p.m.)

Woods Hole team helps map Titanic site

Scientists say they have stitched together the most detailed map of the Titanic shipwreck to learn more about its sinking 100 years ago. (Boston Globe, 3:28 p.m.)

Pictures

Solar storm sparks northern lights

A solar storm shook the Earth's magnetic field early today, leaving in its wake brilliant scenes of the northern lights that appeared farther south than usual.

Anti-Ugandan despot video draws ire

The wildly successful viral video campaign to raise global awareness of Joseph Kony, a brutal rebel leader, is attracting criticism from Ugandans. (AP, 10:19 a.m.)

Deaths of child, mother, two other victims in Mattapan massacre are described

Amanihotep Smith, the youngest and smallest of the four victims of the 2010 shooting, was struck by two bullets, a pathologist testified today. (Globe, 4:41 p.m.)
